page.title: 08EXTERNAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: In Apperley there are five parents who work at{Cheltenham}for the {Government {Communications Headquarters }which has occupied two sites there since 1952. It is a highly secret organisation, achieving publicity during 1984 when the{Conservative {Government of Mrs. Thatcher arbitrarily banned trade unions on the grounds of 'national security'. Workers there are highly educated and comprise many academic disciplines including engineering, mathematics, linguistics electronics and computing. Accordingly they seek accommodation in attractive housing areas such as Apperley. Other major employers of professional people within commuting distance of Apperley is the {Severn-Trent Water Authority}and {Dowty Mining,}making hydraulic pit props in{Tewkesbury.
